text.0: o agni king and lord of wealth and treasures in thee is my delight at sacrifices.
text.1: through thee may we obtain the strength we long for and overcome the fierce attacks of mortals.
text.2: agni eternal father offeringbearer fair to behold farreaching farrefulgent.
text.3: from wellkept household fire beam food to feed us and measure out to us abundant glory.
text.4: the sage of men the lord of human races pure purifying agni balmed with butter.
text.5: him the omniscient as your priest ye stablish he wins among the gods things worth the choosing.
text.6: agni enjoy of one accord with iḷā striving in rivalry with beams of sūrya.
text.7: enjoy o jātavedas this our fuel and bring the gods to us to taste oblations.
text.8: as dear housefriend guest welcome in the dwelling to this our sacrifice come thou who knowest.
text.9: and agni having scattered all assailants bring to us the possessions of our foemen.
text.10: drive thou away the dasyu with thy weapon as gaining vital power for thine own body.
text.11: o son of strength the gods thou satisfiest so in fight save us most heroic agni.
text.12: may we o agni with our lauds adore thee and with our gifts fairbeaming purifier.
text.13: send to us wealth containing all things precious bestow upon us every sort of riches.
text.14: son of strength agni dweller in three regions accept our sacrifice and our oblation.
text.15: among the gods may we be counted pious protect us with a triplyguarding shelter.
text.16: over all woes and dangers jātavedas bear us as in a boat across a river.
text.17: praised with our homage even as atri praised thee o agni be the guardian of our bodies.
text.18: as i remembering thee with grateful spirit a mortal call with might on thee immortal.
text.19: vouchsafe us high renown o jātavedas and may i be immortal by my children.
text.20: the pious man o jātavedas agni to whom thou grantest ample room and pleasure.
text.21: gaineth abundant wealth with sons and horses with heroes and with kine for his wellbeing.
